summary: This document is a series of email exchanges between attorneys regarding procedural matters in the criminal case USA v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss filing responses to motions concerning witness testimony (Witness-3) and the authentication of birth certificates (GX-52). It includes an automated court notice of a letter motion filed by the USA.

events.title: Filing of Letter Motion on Birth Certificates
events.description: The USA files a letter motion addressed to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the authentication of birth certificates in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Attorney Coordination on Case Filings
events.description: Attorneys, including Christian Everdell, coordinate via email to file responses concerning Witness-3 and exhibit GX-52 (birth certificates).

locations: U.S. District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document shows active legal proceedings in USA v. Ghislaine Maxwell on November 22, 2021, concerning motions about witness testimony and birth certificate authentication.
A letter motion from the USA was filed to authenticate birth certificates, identified as exhibit GX-52.
The defense team, including Christian Everdell, was coordinating a response related to 'Witness-3'.
The email chain indicates procedural coordination between attorneys and references a prior letter already on the docket (document 457).
The court's automated notice lists numerous attorneys of record for Ghislaine Maxwell, showing the composition of her legal defense team at that time.
